parameters: "I am here to represent the developer and give
some deeper insight into the game's development and
"The game started development around may 2021 and took
about 2 months to finish, with an additional month
"Originally the game was supposed to be done by
early july, but then the scope got a little out of
"This game was originally based on an illustration I
made, which later inspired fios design."
"In the first draft Fio was going to be the bad guy
whose motive was that he was overly obsessed with
Crow. So a pretty run-of-the-mill yandere story."
"I felt that could come off as demonizing mental
illness though, and I also wanted a more unique story."
"The theme of this game is very much based around
the 'cute on the surface, but scary on the inside'
"It's something you see mostly in anime and anime-style
games. Especially in the indie dev scene, there are a
"Something 'cute and childish' gets robbed of it's
innocence, leaving the viewer behind with a feeling
of paranoia towards things that can usually be trusted."
"Personally I just like drawing cute things and horror
so I combined them, it doesn't get much deeper than
"While I entertained the thought of a sequel for a
while, I probably won't go through with it."
"I won't get into details on how a sequel would even
work, but I have ideas, let's put it that way."
"Either way, there are other games I would like to
explore. I cannot spoil any details yet, but it will be
Fio grew up in a rich home, sheltered by his parents.
He was homeschooled and forbidden to interact
with the outside world at large.
In turn he rarely ever got shot down when asking
for anything else. Despite his parents acting very
unloving and distant, they would grant him most of
He was also the one in charge of the inside
While he doesn't have a good relationship with his
parents, he still thinks of his childhood fondly.
Fio doesn't like to label himself.
He is on the non-binary spectrum, but since in 2010
there wasn't a lot of awareness around different gender
identites, he sees himself as a 'boy outside the box'.
Fio is exclusively attracted to men-identified people,
although he prefers more cute/feminine energy
and couldn't care less for macho types.
In the original draft of this story, Fio was supposed
to be the antagonist. A bit of a 'yandere' type so
In the end I couldn't bring myself to make this sweet
boy into a killer so I rewrote the entire plot.
His whole concept is the 'everything looks cute but
is actually creepy' and I felt like I could achieve
that without making him evil. I hope I did!
Crow grew up in a small remote town to white
conservative parents. He had a pretty normal childhood
until his puberty, where he realized that he wasn't
Knowing that his parents wouldn't let him transition,
he started hormones in secret after turning 18.
With all the changes happening, he wasn't able to keep
it a secret for long, so his parents kicked him out.
Crow lived inside his car for a few months until
he had saved up enough money working. At last he sold
his car and moved to the city, where he planned to make
his debut as an indie rock singer and guitarist.
Crow is FTM (Female to Male) Transgender.
He doesn't talk about it a lot (if he talks at all)
but he also doesn't hide it when asked, unless for
While Crow doesn't care about 'parts' he prefers
In the first version of this game, Crow actually had
a lot more dialogue going more in depth with his
character. But I felt it was more appropriate for him
to be silent outside of flashbacks.
Even when he talks, he is the silent type.
Icarus was created by mixing Sofias DNA and Fios DNA.
Unlike Fio and Crow, there is no "orginal human"
version, since the first Icarus started off as an
Icarus was the final straw to getting this experiment
to succeed, however since that didn't bear fruits
either, Fios parents decided to run the experiment
When the final iteration became aware of this
development, they decided to kill off their creators.
Bringing the experiment to fruition is their only
Icarus is intersex, and while they pretend to be
female for most of the game, they do not view
themselves as any gender. Them being intersex has
nothing to do with their lack of morality.
Thinking about their gender identity or sexuality seems
like a waste of time in their eyes, as their only
goal in life is to bring the experiment that brought
them to life to an end.
I use they/them and Icarus to describe this character
in the bonus room, however any pronouns or names are
fine to use for them, as long as it's clear who you
In an earlier version of the climax there is a bigger
reveal for Icarus's identity, but somehow I wasn't able
to put it in the game in any way that made sense.
Now you kind of have to piece it together yourself,
I wouldn't be surprised if most players have no idea
what their deal is until visiting this room.
In the end I feel like I've gotten in over my head
with their character, but I hope you enjoyed them
as a villain non the less!
This is Crows first design. He was actually the second
character I designed for the game, Fio being the first.
The vibe I was going for was a mix between visual-key
and 00's hottopic. Although being a european who has
had neither of these things as part of my culture
growing up, take that with a grain of salt.
I feel like I default a lot to the same kind of
hairstyle when it comes to the 'cool guy' type of
character, which is why I wanted to go a bit crazy
Fio was the first character I designed. He is
originally based on an illustration, which you can also
In the illustration he is a bunny boy, so I tried
to emulate that a little with his hair floof.
The overall vibe I was going for was cute and a
little out of touch with modern trends, since he
Sofia was intended to be in her thirties at first, but
as the story developed I realized that it was better
if she was closer to Fio and Crows age group, which is
why she looks a lot younger in the final game.
I never got to show off what Icarus looks like under
their mask, so at last; here they are.
Although this isn't really an accurate display of
what they look like during the game, as they are a lot
In an earlier version of the climax they were supposed
to reveal their face, but I just couldn't fit it in
Which is a shame, I love the shaggy hair.
